title: Golden rectangle
summary: In geometry, a golden rectangle is a rectangle whose side lengths are in the golden ratio, 1 : 1 + 5 2 {\displaystyle 1:{\tfrac {1+{\sqrt {5}}}{2}}} , which is 1 : φ {\displaystyle 1:\varphi } (the Greek letter phi), where φ {\displaystyle \varphi } is approximately 1.618.
